heading: sony joins personal stereo queue
subheading: even as it celebrates 20 years of the walkman, sony looks to the future and offers up its own mp3-friendly player. introducing the ms walkman. arik hesseldahl reports from new york.
author: arik hesseldahl
text: new york -- what was life like before the walkman stereo? music was something you played at home on a bulky stereo appliance. with stores selling only vinyl records or eight-track tapes, people used relatively new-fangled cassette tapes to mix their favorite tracks, stirring a pot of legal controversy over whether it should be legal to copy those records for free.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
